title: Put Executives on the Tools, Not Just the Strategy
insight: Executives who don't personally use AI make bad decisions about AI transformation. Demos don't build intuition; doing real work does.
manifestations: BCG Trailblazers: CEOs spend 8+ hours/week personally using AI on real work
Microsoft: Nadella restructured executives to work as individual contributors on AI products
Mercado Libre: Founder stepped down as CEO to focus hands-on on AI
Commonwealth Bank: CEO personally drove 50K deployment, not delegated to IT
test: When did your C-suite last use AI tools on their own real workâ€”not watch a demo, not review someone else's output, but actually use the tools? If you can't remember, executive judgment on AI is uninformed.
